name: Rain Garden Tour and Guided Plant Walk
description: In June, Green Venture hosted the Laidlaw Memorial United Church Planting Event, participating in the Living Cities project to bring accessible green spaces to Hamilton! With additional funding from ArcelorMittal Dofasco‚Äôs Corporate Community Fund, Green Cities Foundation, Rain Haven, and Tree Canada, we transformed over 2000 sq feet of lawn, pavement, and concrete into an urban green space filled with 500+ native species and trees. This guided rain garden tour and plant walk will allow you to explore the new rain gardens at Laidlaw Memorial United Church and learn about the design and plant selection from the Landscape Architect, Adele Pierre. Bring any gardening and plant design questions you have and we‚Äôll be happy to answer!

name: Food Harvesting Workshop at Niwasa Kendaaswin Teg/McQuesten Urban Farm
description: Explore the Niwas‚Äãa Kendaaswin Teg/McQuesten Urban Farm and learn from urban gardeners about food harvesting, community-oriented food initiatives, water efficient gardening and more! This event promotes hands on learning as we join with our partners Niwas‚Äãa Kendaaswin Teg /McQuesten Urban Farm for some seasonal stewardship on their farm. Seasonal tasks include: weeding, planting and harvesting! Be sure to wear closed-toed shoes and long pants. Bring a reusable water bottle, sunscreen and a hat!

name: Waterfront Walking Tour
description: Join us on an educational and engaging Waterfront Walking Tour in Bayfront Park with the Bay Area Restoration Council (BARC) and Tim Crowley from the City of Hamilton! All are welcome to attend regardless of age or ability. Staff from the Bay Area Restoration Council and the City of Hamilton will guide us on a walk to discuss grey infrastructure in Hamilton (e.g., storm sewers, combined overflow tanks, separate and combined systems), our watershed, and community greening opportunities. On this guided walk, we will explore the bay, learn more about Hamilton‚Äôs stormwater system, and enjoy a leisurely stroll on the trail. Please bring comfortable walking shoes, a hat, and sunscreen.
location: Bayfront Park (BARC Kiosk near trail entrance)

name: Rain Harvesting Info Night
description: Drop by and learn from Norm Newbery and Erinn Turnball about some of the Green Infrastructure features on-site at St.John the Evangelist while also learning about the project‚Äôs history! The Green Infrastructure elements on site, like the rain gardens and the holding tank with pump and soaker hoses, are an excellent demonstration of water management and efficiency in an urban setting! üåßÔ∏èüí¶ The holding tank catches and retains stormwater to distribute through the pump and soaker hoses. Then, these hoses encourage healthier plant growth and water absorption by distributing the water at the root level, generating healthier plants designed and arranged to help hold excess amounts of water year-round! BONUS: attendees will receive native plant seed packets!
location: The Church of Saint John the Evangelist

name: Yellow Fish Road
description: Celebrate the end of Stormwater Week on Friday, August 9 2024 from 5-6:00PM with a fun community education initiative! Join the Bay Area Restoration Council (BARC) and Green Venture as we paint yellow fish onto sewer grates, encouraging local residents to remember the influence that their water runoff has on local waterways, species, and ecosystems. Be prepared to paint and community educate!

name: Invasive Removal with HCA
description: Join Green Venture and the Hamilton Conservation Authority at the Windermere Basin as we remove invasive plants from the site.
organization: Green Venture and Hamilton Conservation Authority

name: Hamilton Farmers Market
description: Visit Green Venture‚Äôs station near the entrance to the Hamilton Farmer‚Äôs Market on August 9th. Learn about our seed libraries and make pollinator planter kits and seed balls.

name: Rain Garden Tours
description: Take a self-paced tour and view various Rain Gardens around the city to see how Green Infrastructure can slow down the flow of rainwater and prevent flooding in Hamilton. Homeowners will be available to show their gardens and answer questions.

name: Youth Showcase
description: Youth are invited to see the projects completed by the high school participants in our Youth Stewardship & Professional Skills Program! Also includes FREE FOOD and an exciting guest speaker. More details to come!

name: Summer Party
description: Join Green Venture for a summer party at EcoHouse for a tea party, clothing swap, vendor market and more activities!

name: Barton Farmer's Market
description: Come to the Barton Farmer‚Äôs Market and visit Green Venture‚Äôs station to learn about community involvement opportunities.

name: Garden Stewardship at Our Lady of Vietnam Church
description: Help us maintain our green spaces around Our Lady of Vietnam Church from 9:00-10:30am on Thursday, August 29th.
